intro: Chascanum angolense subsp. angolense, commonly known as the Angola chascanum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is more commonly found in the wild.
